CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 9, 1972, pg. 1 reads: "Prison Strike - Some 40 demonstrators marched at Western Penitentiary in support of a statewide prison work stoppage. By the court of the state Bureau of Correction, some 1000 prisoners went on strike Sept. 5 at 3 institutions including 150 at Western Penitentiary.  The strike is to dramatize a list of 41 grievances dealing with prison conditions and policies...Demonstrators walked along the railroad tracks near the Ohio River as the young woman in the middle, where they could be seen by the inmates...-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Boy, and woman holding protest sign reading "Decent Prison Wages," standing on train tracks along the Ohio River near Western Penitentiary
